text: Tonganoxie (pronounced ) is a city in Leavenworth County, Kansas. It is part of the Kansas City metropolitan area within the United States. In 2020, 5,573 people lived there. ==History== Tonganoxie was platted in 1866. It was named after a local Native American Chief from the Delaware Tribe whose name means "shorty" in the Delaware language. Tonganoxie was incorporated as a city in the late 1870s. ==Geography== Tonganoxie is at (39.108880, -95.086885). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . Of that, is land and is water. ===Weather=== Tonganoxie has hot, humid summers and generally cold winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Tonganoxie has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Tonganoxie, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 5,573 people, 2,087 households, and 1,482 families living in Tonganoxie. Of the households, 71.1% owned their home and 28.9% rented their home. The median age was 36.0 years. Of the people, 87.3% were White, 1.5% were Black, 0.8% were Native American, 0.6% were Asian, 1.5% were from some other race, and 8.2% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 5.7% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 4,996 people, 1,884 households, and 1,338 families living in Tonganoxie. ==Famous people== * Danni Boatwright, winner of Survivor: Guatemala, Miss Kansas USA 1996 * Connie O'Brien, member of the Kansas House of Representatives ==References== ==Other websites== * City of Tonganoxie * Tonganoxie - Directory of Public Officials * Tonganoxie City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Leavenworth County, Kansas Category:1866 establishments in Kansas
title: Tonganoxie, Kansas
